TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EventRoute extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the container for the route to be followed by a routed event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class corresponds to a valid <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEvent>, and contains an ordered list of target object and handler list pairs that refer to the event route for that event. <xref:System.Windows.EventRoute> supports adding new entries to the list and also allows for the handlers in the list to be invoked.
Most normal operations for adding handlers for [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] events do not require working with this class (for instance, use <xref:System.Windows.EventManager> methods to add class handling, or query for existing handlers of an event). This class is mainly for use when elements have particular knowledge about child elements or parent elements that make it practical to either add elements to or remove elements from the default calculated event route.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent) cil managed

Docs.param: The non-NULL event identifier to be associated with this event route.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Add (object target, Delegate handler, bool handledEventsToo);
.method public hidebysig instance void Add(object target, class System.Delegate handler, bool handledEventsToo) cil managed
Public Sub Add (target As Object, handler As Delegate, handledEventsToo As Boolean)
public: void Add(System::Object ^ target, Delegate ^ handler, bool handledEventsToo);
member this.Add : obj * Delegate * bool -> unit

Docs.param: Specifies the target object of which the handler is to be added to the route.
Specifies the handler to be added to the route.
Indicates whether or not the listener detects events that have already been handled.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified handler for the specified target to the route.

remarks.format: ## Remarks It is not an error to add a handler for a particular target instance twice. In such a case, the handler will be called twice.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object PeekBranchNode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the top-most element on the event route stack at which two logical trees diverge.
Docs.returns: The top-most element on the event route stack at which two logical trees diverge.

Docs.summary: Returns the source for the top-most element on the event route stack at which two logical trees diverge.
Docs.returns: The source for the top-most element on the event route stack at which two logical trees diverge.

Docs.summary: Returns the top-most node on the event route stack at which two logical trees diverge.
Docs.returns: The top-most node on the event route stack at which two logical trees diverge.

Docs.param: The top-most element on the event route stack at which two logical trees diverge.
The source for the top-most element on the event route stack at which two logical trees diverge.
Docs.summary: Adds the top-most node to the event route stack at which two logical trees diverge.
